org.sd.cluster.service
Interface ProcessHandle

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
All Known Implementing Classes:
ClusterProcessHandle
public interface ProcessHandle
extends java.lang.Runnable

Runnable container for sending, monitoring, and collecting the service task's results.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Method Summary
 void close()
          Close this process handle (when finished).
 boolean finished()
          Determine whether the underlying process has finished.
 long[] getCompletionRatio()
          Get the ratio of completion.
 java.lang.Throwable getError()
          Get an error from the process if present.
 long getProcessingTime()
          Get the time this handle used for processing.
 ServiceResults getResults()
          Get the results from this handle if processing is finished and results are available.
 java.lang.String getServiceKey()
          Get a unique key that identifies this handle and distinguishes it from others.
 boolean hasResults()
          Determine whether this handle has retrievable results.
 void kill()
          Send this handle's process a kill signal.
 boolean resetFinished()
          Reset finished from "true" to "false".
 ServiceResults runUntilDone(long checkInterval, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean die)
          Wait until the process has finished or a signal to die has been issued, returning the current results.

Get a unique key that identifies this handle and distinguishes it from others.

Get an error from the process if present.

finished

boolean finished()
Determine whether the underlying process has finished.

resetFinished

boolean resetFinished()
Reset finished from "true" to "false".

Returns:
true if successfully reset; otherwise, false.

kill

void kill()
Send this handle's process a kill signal.

hasResults

boolean hasResults()
Determine whether this handle has retrievable results.

getResults

ServiceResults getResults()
Get the results from this handle if processing is finished and results are available.

Returns:
the results or null.

getProcessingTime

long getProcessingTime()
Get the time this handle used for processing.

getCompletionRatio

long[] getCompletionRatio()
Get the ratio of completion.
  • doneSoFar -- the total number of units of work done so far or -1 if counting has not been started.
  • toBeDone -- the total number of units of work to be done or -1 if unknown.

Returns:
{doneSoFar, toBeDone}

close

void close()
Close this process handle (when finished).

runUntilDone

ServiceResults runUntilDone(long checkInterval,
                            java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean die)
Wait until the process has finished or a signal to die has been issued, returning the current results.

Parameters:
checkInterval - Amount of time to wait between checking for termination.
die - Flag to monitor for signal to end (ok if null).
Returns:
non-null ServiceResults, possibly incomplete.
